intro: Blakea verrucosa, commonly known as the warty blakea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, clustered in inflorescences at the base of the leaves. Blakea verrucosa is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests.
